metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin) Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    (Pick caffeine, DMT, dopamine, ethanol, harmine, MDMA, mescaline, serotonin, tryptamine, nitrous, THC, or psilocybin)

Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin)

Effects

by Erowid

DURATION #

Caution : Reactions and experiences may vary dramatically from person to person. [see below]

Oxycodone Duration Oral Total Duration 3 - 6 hrs Onset 10 - 30 mins Coming Up 30 - 60 mins Plateau 2 - 4 hrs Coming Down 30 - 60 mins

EFFECTS LIST #

POSITIVE

analgesia, reduction of pain (common)

sedation, sleepiness (common)

anxiolysis, reduction of anxiety (less common)

euphoria, mood improvement (less common)

feelings of relaxation (less common)

NEUTRAL

pupil constriction

sweating (common)

slowed reaction time (common)

changes in focus, attention, and thought (common)

impaired thinking, confusion (less common)

loss of appetite (less common)

hiccups (uncommon)

changes in vision (uncommon)

NEGATIVE

constipation (common)

nausea, vomiting (common)

dizziness, headache (common)


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed information on the effects, duration, and side effects of oxycodone, a semi-synthetic opioid analgesic, as listed on the Erowid pharmaceuticals vault. It includes specific data on onset times, positive, neutral, and negative effects, and caution notes, making it crucial for understanding oxycodone's impact within the broader context of psychoactive substances covered on the webpage.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin) Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    loss of appetite (less common)

hiccups (uncommon)

changes in vision (uncommon)

NEGATIVE

constipation (common)

nausea, vomiting (common)

dizziness, headache (common)

itching/pruritus (common)

dry mouth (common)

hyperalgesia, increased sensitivity to pain (rebound pain) (usually after stopping use)

fatigue, weakness (common)

nervousness (less common)

sleeplessness/insomnia (less common)

fever (less common)

diarrhea (usually after stopping use, 'rebound diarrhea') (less common)

difficulty urinating (less common)

clammy skin (less common)

light-headedness, fainting (less common)

acute withdrawal symptoms if physically dependent

decreased interest in sex (with habitual use)

abdominal pain (uncommon)

rash (uncommon)

seizures, convulsions (uncommon)

difficulty breathing (uncommon)

respiratory depression, respiratory arrest (uncommon)

tinnitus (very uncommon)

circulatory depression, shock (very uncommon)


                    Context: 
                    This chunk lists common and less common negative effects associated with oxycodone, including symptoms like loss of appetite, hiccups, changes in vision, and more serious adverse effects such as respiratory depression and withdrawal symptoms. It is part of the detailed effects section within the Erowid oxycodone drug profile, aiding users in understanding potential risks and side effects.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin) Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    seizures, convulsions (uncommon)

difficulty breathing (uncommon)

respiratory depression, respiratory arrest (uncommon)

tinnitus (very uncommon)

circulatory depression, shock (very uncommon)

Some adverse effects may be alleviated by lying down. Nausea, vomiting and other concerning effects may increase as dose increases.

DESCRIPTION #

Oxycodone is a semi-synthetic opioid analgesic used to treat moderate to severe pain. It is most effective treating acute pain rather than chronic pain. The precise mechanism of action of oxycodone and other opiates is not known, although it is believed to relate to the existence of opiate receptors in the central nervous system.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed information on the negative adverse effects of oxycodone, including rare symptoms like seizures and respiratory issues, as well as a general description of the drug's use and mechanism. It is part of the comprehensive "Effects" section, which categorizes positive, neutral, and negative effects to aid understanding and searchability within the full drug information document.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin) Vault : Effects
metadata.description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).

content:
Drug: Oxycodone | cid: 5284603
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about the mental and physical effects of Oxycodone (Percocet, Oxycontin).
Erowid name: oxycodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Effects

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's effects information is a summary of data gathered from users, research, and other resources. This information is intended to describe the range of effects people report experiencing. Effects may vary dramatically from one person to another or one experience to another based on a variety of factors such as body chemistry, age, gender, physical health, dose, form of material, etc.

ADDITIONAL RESOURCES #

Links #

None

                    Context:

It provides a summary of the limitations and variability of effects based on user-reported data, emphasizing caution and the importance of individual differences. This section is key for understanding the caveats associated with interpreting the effects information in the broader context of drug details.
